user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8 is: A function parameter should not be modified.
Note that the object referred to by a pointer parameter may be modified, but the pointer itself shall not be modified.
</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of get_nonce_timestamp:
```c
static bool
get_nonce_timestamp (const char *const nonce,
                     size_t noncelen,
                     uint64_t *const ptimestamp)
{
  if (0 == noncelen)
    noncelen = strlen (nonce);

  if (true
#ifdef MHD_MD5_SUPPORT
      && (NONCE_STD_LEN (MD5_DIGEST_SIZE) != noncelen)
#endif /* MHD_MD5_SUPPORT */
#if defined(MHD_SHA256_SUPPORT) || defined(MHD_SHA512_256_SUPPORT)
      && (NONCE_STD_LEN (SHA256_SHA512_256_DIGEST_SIZE) != noncelen)
#endif /* MHD_SHA256_SUPPORT */
      )
    return false;

  if (TIMESTAMP_CHARS_LEN !=
      MHD_strx_to_uint64_n_ (nonce + noncelen - TIMESTAMP_CHARS_LEN,
                             TIMESTAMP_CHARS_LEN,
                             ptimestamp))
    return false;
  return true;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are close to the target function get_nonce_timestamp:
#define NONCE_STD_LEN(digest_size) ((digest_size)*2+TIMESTAMP_CHARS_LEN)
...
#define MD5_DIGEST_SIZE (MD5_DIGEST_SIZE_WORDS*MD5_BYTES_IN_WORD)
...
#define MHD_MD5_SUPPORT 1
...
#define SHA256_SHA512_256_DIGEST_SIZE SHA512_256_DIGEST_SIZE
...
#define MHD_SHA256_SUPPORT 1
...
#define MHD_SHA512_256_SUPPORT 1
...
#define TIMESTAMP_CHARS_LEN (TIMESTAMP_BIN_SIZE*2)
...
size_t
MHD_strx_to_uint64_n_ (const char *str,
                       size_t maxlen,
                       uint64_t *out_val)
{
  size_t i;
  uint64_t res;
  int digit;
  if (! str || ! out_val)
    return 0;

  res = 0;
  i = 0;
  while (i < maxlen && (digit = toxdigitvalue (str[i])) >= 0)
  {
    if ( (res > (UINT64_MAX / 16)) ||
         ((res == (UINT64_MAX / 16)) &&
          ( (uint64_t) digit > (UINT64_MAX % 16)) ) )
      return 0;

    res *= 16;
    res += (unsigned int) digit;
    i++;
  }

  if (i)
    *out_val = res;
  return i;
}
</additional code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
  if (0 == noncelen)
    noncelen = strlen (nonce);
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 17.8 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: When noncelen == 0 the code executes the assignment "noncelen = strlen(nonce);" which writes to the function parameter noncelen. Modifying a parameter variable (even a non-pointer value parameter) violates MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8. A compliant fix is to copy the parameter to a local variable (e.g. size_t len = noncelen;) and modify that local variable instead.
